meanings.definition: To write or draw hastily or carelessly.
meanings.sent1: She would often scribble notes in her notebook during class.
meanings.sent2: The child would always scribble on the walls with crayons.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, he tried to scribble down the phone number but ended up with a messy scrawl.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was racing so fast that her thoughts seemed to scribble across the page.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hand moved quickly to scribble the outline of the figure.

meanings.definition: A piece of writing or drawing done hastily or carelessly.
meanings.sent1: The note was just a scribble, barely legible.
meanings.sent2: Among the doodles and scribbles in the margins, there was a hidden message.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked across the paper, leaving a trail of tiny scribbles behind.
meanings.sent4: The old journal was filled with faded scribbles from years past.
meanings.sent5: The teacher couldn't decipher the scribble on the back of the test paper.
